_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary for Dorman Brothers, LLC-Goodland

For further information regarding this plan, please contact:
Michael B. Dorman
19230 County Rd. 55
Burlington, CO  80807
719/346-7970

1.  Facility Policy
The owners, members, and employees of Dorman Brohters, LLC are committed to the prevention of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the business is prepared to work with the local fire deparement and other agencies to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2.  Facility Information
This facility makes sure that the most current safety measures are implemented.  The primary activity at this facility is the storage of fertilizer for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application.  The ammonia is delivered in by truck.

3.  The Accidental Release Prevention Program
This facility has implemented the provisions of Safety Requirments for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia K-61-1, published by the American National Standards, Institute, Inc. and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration, 29 CFR 1920-111, Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia.

4.  The Five Year Accident History
There has been no accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.

5.  The Emgergency Action Plan
The facility has:
-A written Emergency Action Plan
-It provides SARA Title III information to the state and local authoritites
-Does employee training

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Safety improvements are an on-going process at this facility.  Periodic inspections are performed to assess the maintenace of safe conditions.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations at this time.
